page.title: 02RECREATION IN HAYES
page.content: In Hayes there are a lot of things to do in your spare time. Scouts, Cub Scouts, Beavers, Girl Guides, Brownies, Boys Brigade, Chess Club, Hayes Players Drama Club, Tennis Club and Badminton Club. Hayes Primary visited the Squash Club which has over 2000 members and about one-third come every week. They have 16 indoor courts. Open every day except Bank Holidays, they also play racket ball, snooker and pool. It costs Â£84 a person or Â£126 a family plus the cost per session. They also have a bar. Hayes Common is an area for recreation now, but used to be used for grazing cattle and pigs and for collecting berries and wood. The green area surrounded by trees on three sides is used in the summer for village activities, this includes the May Day celebration.
